title: How to Fold an Origami Peacock

steps.headline: Fold the paper in half, creating a horizontal crease in the middle of the paper.
Fold the left bottom edge of the paper inwards so it meets the middle crease.
steps.description: Repeat on the other side. The paper should resemble a kite.

steps.headline: Fold the middle corners down and out so the lines meet the outer edges.
Fold the bottom half upwards so the bottom point meets the top point.
Take the top point and fold down and to the right, making a new triangle.
Fold the back right half of the paper back and to the left.
steps.description: As you fold the back portion to the back left, pull the tip of the far right triangle and flatten it out along the back side. This may take some practice.

steps.headline: Take the right corner and fold to the left and up until it meets the middle.
“Hood" fold along the crease you just made.
steps.description: “Hood” folding means separating a corner of paper and folding it backwards over itself.

steps.headline: Do another "hood" fold at the top of the triangle you just made.
steps.description: This will resemble the beak of the peacock.

steps.headline: Step fold along the dotted lines.
steps.description: Fold forward along the first line and then backwards along the second line.

steps.headline: Flip 180 degrees, and do the same on the other side.
Unfold these folds - these will be the tail feathers of the peacock.
Fold the top corner backwards to round out the tail feathers.

text: Fold the paper in half, creating a horizontal crease in the middle of the paper. Then unfold. Fold the left bottom edge of the paper inwards so it meets the middle crease. Repeat on the other side. The paper should resemble a kite. Fold the middle corners down and out so the lines meet the outer edges.  Fold the bottom half upwards so the bottom point meets the top point.  Take the top point and fold down and to the right, making a new triangle.  Fold the back right half of the paper back and to the left. As you fold the back portion to the back left, pull the tip of the far right triangle and flatten it out along the back side. This may take some practice. Take the right corner and fold to the left and up until it meets the middle.  “Hood" fold along the crease you just made. “Hood” folding means separating a corner of paper and folding it backwards over itself. Do another "hood" fold at the top of the triangle you just made. This will resemble the beak of the peacock. Step fold along the dotted lines. Fold forward along the first line and then backwards along the second line. Flip 180 degrees, and do the same on the other side.  Unfold these folds - these will be the tail feathers of the peacock.  Fold the top corner backwards to round out the tail feathers.
